Package ohos.hiviewdfx.xcollie

Class XCollie

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.hiviewdfx.xcollie.XCollie

  • public final class XCollie
extends Object
    Provides methods for detecting application or service timeouts. This class defines a mechanism for detecting time-consuming service processing.

    An application or a service uses this mechanism to check whether a key service procedure times out. For example, if a procedure is not completed within 5 seconds as expected, the application is notified of the timeout. Upon receiving the notification, the application will take proper measures. 

        // Start timeout detection.
    int id = XCollie.getInstance().setTimeout("ServiceTimeout", 5, new Runnable(){
        @Override
        public void run () {
            // do something
        }
    }, XCollie.XCOLLIE_FLAG_NOOP);
    // Do something.
    // Cancel timeout detection.
    XCollie.getInstance().cancelTimeout(id);
    Since:
    4

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static long XCOLLIE_FLAG_LOG
      Indicates that logs are printed after a timeout detected via setTimeout.
      static long XCOLLIE_FLAG_NOOP
      Indicates that no operation is performed after a timeout detected via setTimeout.
      static long XCOLLIE_FLAG_RECOVERY
      Indicates that the application or service exits for recovery after a timeout detected via setTimeout.
      static int XCOLLIE_INVALID_ID
      Indicates an invalid value of the timeout detection handle to be returned when timeout detection fails to be started by setTimeout.

        Returns the XCollie instance.
        Since:

      • setTimeout

        public int setTimeout​(String timeoutName,
                      int timeout,
                      Runnable callback,
                      long flag)
        Starts timeout detection.

        When handling a time-consuming procedure, an application or service calls this method to check whether the procedure times out.

        Parameters:
        timeoutName - Indicates the timeout name.
        timeout - Indicates the timeout length, in seconds.
        callback - Indicates the callback upon a timeout.
        flag - Indicates the processing flag for a timeout. The value can be:
        • XCOLLIE_FLAG_NOOP: No operation is performed except that the callback is invoked to notify the application of the timeout.
        • XCOLLIE_FLAG_RECOVERY: The callback is invoked to notify the application of the timeout, and the application or service exits for recovery.
        • XCOLLIE_FLAG_LOG: The callback is invoked to notify the application of the timeout, and logs are printed.
        Returns:
        Returns a timeout detection handle if the detection is started successfully; returns XCOLLIE_INVALID_ID otherwise.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        XCOLLIE_FLAG_NOOP, XCOLLIE_FLAG_RECOVERY, XCOLLIE_INVALID_ID

      • cancelTimeout

        public void cancelTimeout​(int id)
        Cancels timeout detection.
        Parameters:
        id - Indicates the timeout detection handle.
        Since:
        4

      • updateTimeout

        public boolean updateTimeout​(int id,
                             long timeout)
        Updates the timeout length.
        Parameters:
        id - Indicates the timeout detection handle.
        timeout - Indicates the updated timeout length, in seconds.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the update is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4
